name: Doctor Alex Richards

topics.response_text: I hear you defeated the Legion forces at Nelson. I'm impressed, and thankful. It'll make my job around here much easier.
Hey! Be careful, I don't like people hurting my patients.
You killed him! What kind of Doctor are you? Get out of here now!

topics.topic_text: Major Polatli said you might need some help.
topics.response_text: With business booming like it is and considering I'm the only person with medical experience in the camp, I could perhaps use a hand.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to talk to you about your missing medical supplies.
topics.response_text: I heard Private Stone turned himself in for stealing my medical supplies. You have my thanks.
I don't have that many supplies left, so I can't offer my services freely, but I can help you.

topics.topic_text: I finished looking over your patients.
topics.response_text: Excellent job. Where did you learn how to do all that? I don't think that I could have done much better myself. Very impressive.

topics.topic_text: Yes. I have some medical experience.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Excellent. As you can see, we have a lot of injured troopers here and I haven't had time to look at all of them yet.
Excellent. As you can see, we have a lot of injured troopers here and I haven't had time to look at all of them yet.
Without any medical experience, you're not going to be much use to me in here.

topics.topic_text: I have wounds that need mending.
topics.response_text: You look fine to me. Well, as fine as anyone else around here.

topics.topic_text: Yes. Private Stone was stealing them.
topics.response_text: Is that so! I'll have to talk to Major Polatli about this right away.
Let me know when you do find something out.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> I wasn't able to find out anything.
topics.response_text: That's too bad. These men really needed those supplies.

topics.topic_text: I'm not qualified to examine your patients.
topics.response_text: That's too bad, but at least you didn't start hacking and slashing with a knife. I don't think Major Polatli could handle two doctors like that.

topics.topic_text: I did what I could for your patients.
topics.response_text: Thanks for your help. I'll take it from here.
[FAILED] Ahh... I see. Unfortunately you're experience with "medicology" isn't going to be any use to me here.
With the Legion defeated, things are great now.

topics.topic_text: I have some questions for you.
topics.response_text: What would you like to know?

topics.topic_text: Things look pretty rough in here.
topics.response_text: Men have waged war on each other for countless centuries. Now is no different.

topics.topic_text: It looks like you have a decent facility here.
topics.response_text: Someone with medical experience, I take it? It's not the best, but it does the job.

topics.topic_text: You seem to be handling it well.
topics.response_text: I'm doing the best I can considering the poor situation I find myself in.

topics.topic_text: This place looks more like a chop shop.
topics.response_text: Sometimes it does feel that way. I feel more like a mortician than a doctor.

topics.topic_text: What makes you think someone is stealing your supplies?
topics.response_text: The simple fact that I no longer have as many supplies as I should. I've been careful with them and I should have more than what remains.
Anything is possible, but that's unlikely.
I may have my hands full here, but I'm anything but careless.
That's an odd response if I've ever heard one.

topics.topic_text: I can look into this for you.
topics.response_text: That would definitely be appreciated. You might want to ask around and keep an eye out for anything suspicious.
I store a variety of drugs here, but it looks like my supply of Hydra is diminishing rather quickly.

topics.topic_text: Where do you keep your supplies?
topics.response_text: Locked in a cabinet, here in the medical tent. I'm around most of the time, but I can't keep a constant watch on them.

topics.topic_text: When did you notice them missing?
topics.response_text: I remember coming in one morning and noticing that my supplies were lower than they should have been.

topics.topic_text: I can't help you right now.
topics.response_text: Perhaps you can come back and help me when you have more time.

topics.topic_text: I want to talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Okay then, what would you like to talk about?

topics.topic_text: I need help with an addiction.
topics.response_text: You and me both, but let's worry about you first. I can fix you up, if you know what I mean.
Sure can. The sooner the better if you ask me, unless you want a third arm.
Sorry. I'm low on supplies as it is and I don't have any to spare.
Okay, now this might hurt a bit...
Your loss, not mine. Let me know if your hair starts falling out.
Thanks, I'll fix you up right away.
Good luck to you then, junkie.
Excellent, just let me grab my scalpel and a body bag, and we'll get started.
Okay then. Just try not to bleed all over the place, okay?
Okay then.
I used to be a doctor back in California, but a few years back I got suckered into doing military work because it was my "patriotic duty."

topics.topic_text: What are the symptoms of Hydra use?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Excessive use causes dilated eyes, an increased heart rate and blood pressure, massive sweating, you know... the usual.

topics.topic_text: People using Hydra have their skin turn purple, right?
topics.response_text: [FAILED] Good god, no. Look, don't worry about symptoms, just ask around and see if anyone has noticed anything suspicious.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Hoover Dam?
topics.response_text: Quite a bit actually. I was stationed nearby during the first battle of Hoover Dam four years ago. I saw a lot of what happened firsthand.

topics.topic_text: What's your take on the NCR?
topics.response_text: My take? I try not to think about it, I got enough on my hands here.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the first battle.
topics.response_text: The Legion attacked in full force. Chief Hanlon had the troopers fall back pulling the enemy in, before entrenching into secure positions.
You have no idea. It was a fierce battle. Lots of people died.

topics.topic_text: Let's go back to my previous questions.
topics.response_text: Okay, what's on your mind?
Alright. What do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: I found this syringe on Private Stone.
topics.response_text: This is definitely part of my missing supplies. I'll talk to Major Polatli about this right away.
Excellent, just let me grab my scalpel, and a body bag and we'll get started.
My pleasure. Thanks again.
Excellent, just let me grab my scalpel, and a body bag and we'll get started.
Ahh, doing this out of the goodness of your heart. You don't see that very often around here. Thank you.

description:
Doctor Alex Richards is a 38 year-old Caucasian Male.

A weary and cynical doctor who once served the New California Republic with idealistic fervor. Now stationed at Camp Forlorn Hope as the sole medical expert, Richards is overwhelmed by the constant stream of casualties from the ongoing conflict with Caesar's Legion. His once-idealistic view of serving the NCR has been replaced by a grim acceptance of his role as a mere 'bonesaw' who patches soldiers up to continue the cycle of war and death.

Doctor Alex Richards's Personality: Weary, exhausted, and deeply cynical. Despite his hardened exterior, Richards maintains a professional demeanor when treating patients, though he often expresses dark humor about the grim realities of his work. He's seen too much suffering to maintain the idealism that once drove him to join the NCR Army, but continues to perform his duty with grim determination.

Doctor Alex Richards's Backstory: Born and raised in the core lands of the New California Republic, Richards showed an aptitude for medicine from a young age. After completing his medical training, he established a successful practice in one of the NCR's major settlements. However, his idealistic belief in the NCR's mission to civilize the wasteland led him to volunteer for the Army Medical Corps. He served with distinction in several NCR campaigns, but nothing prepared him for the brutal reality of the Mojave front. After witnessing the horrors of battle firsthand, his idealism gradually eroded, replaced by a grim acceptance of the endless cycle of war and suffering.
